description:
Provides a Fastly Service, representing the configuration for a website, app,
API, or anything else to be served through Fastly. A Service encompasses Domains
and Backends.

The Service resource requires a domain name that is correctly set up to direct
traffic to the Fastly service. See Fastly's guide on [Adding CNAME Records][fastly-cname]
on their documentation site for guidance.

Name.description: A unique name to identify this ACL.

Address.description: An IPv4, hostname, or IPv6 address for the Backend.

AutoLoadbalance.description:
Denotes if this Backend should be
included in the pool of backends that requests are load balanced against.
Default `true`.

BetweenBytesTimeout.description: How long to wait between bytes in milliseconds. Default `10000`.

ConnectTimeout.description:
How long to wait for a timeout in milliseconds.
Default `1000`.

ErrorThreshold.description: Number of errors to allow before the Backend is marked as down. Default `0`.

FirstByteTimeout.description: How long to wait for the first bytes in milliseconds. Default `15000`.

Healthcheck.description: Name of a defined `healthcheck` to assign to this backend.

MaxConn.description:
Maximum number of connections for this Backend.
Default `200`.

MaxTlsVersion.description: Maximum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.

MinTlsVersion.description: Minimum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.

Name.description: The unique name for the condition.

OverrideHost.description: The hostname to override the Host header.

Port.description: The port number on which the Backend responds. Default `80`.

RequestCondition.description: Name of already defined `condition`, which if met, will select this backend during a request.

Shield.description: The POP of the shield designated to reduce inbound load.

SslCertHostname.description: Overrides ssl_hostname, but only for cert verification. Does not affect SNI at all.

SslCheckCert.description: Be strict about checking SSL certs. Default `true`.

SslCiphers.description: Comma separated list of OpenSSL Ciphers to try when negotiating to the backend.

SslClientCert.description: Client certificate attached to origin. Used when connecting to the backend.

SslClientKey.description: Client key attached to origin. Used when connecting to the backend.

SslHostname.description: Used for both SNI during the TLS handshake and to validate the cert.

SslSniHostname.description: Overrides ssl_hostname, but only for SNI in the handshake. Does not affect cert validation at all.

UseSsl.description: Whether or not to use SSL to reach the backend. Default `false`.

Weight.description: The [portion of traffic](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/performance-tuning/load-balancing-configuration.html#how-weight-affects-load-balancing) to send to this Backend. Each Backend receives `weight / total` of the traffic. Default `100`.

Dataset.description: The ID of your BigQuery dataset.

Email.description: The email for the service account with write access to your BigQuery dataset. If not provided, this will be pulled from a `FASTLY_BQ_EMAIL` environment variable.

Format.description: Apache style log formatting. Must produce JSON that matches the schema of your BigQuery table.

Name.description: A unique name to identify this BigQuery logging endpoint.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: `none` or `waf_debug`.

ProjectId.description: The ID of your GCP project.

ResponseCondition.description: Name of already defined `condition` to apply. This `condition` must be of type `RESPONSE`. For detailed information about Conditionals, see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals][fastly-conditionals].

SecretKey.description: The secret key associated with the sservice account that has write access to your BigQuery table. If not provided, this will be pulled from the `FASTLY_BQ_SECRET_KEY` environment variable. Typical format for this is a private key in a string with newlines.

Table.description: The ID of your BigQuery table.

Template.description: Big query table name suffix template. If set will be interpreted as a strftime compatible string and used as the [Template Suffix for your table](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/streaming-data-into-bigquery#template-tables).

AccountName.description: The unique Azure Blob Storage namespace in which your data objects are stored.

Container.description: The name of the Azure Blob Storage container in which to store logs.

Format.description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Default `%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b`.

FormatVersion.description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either `1` or `2`. The logging call gets placed by default in `vcl_log` if `format_version` is set to `2` and in `vcl_deliver` if `format_version` is set to `1`. Default `2`.

GzipLevel.description: Level of GZIP compression from `0`to `9`. `0` means no compression. `1` is the fastest and the least compressed version, `9` is the slowest and the most compressed version. Default `0`.

MessageType.description: How the message should be formatted. Can be either `classic`, `loggly`, `logplex` or `blank`.  Default `classic`.

Name.description: A unique name to identify the Azure Blob Storage endpoint.

Path.description: The path to upload logs to. Must end with a trailing slash. If this field is left empty, the files will be saved in the container's root path.

Period.description: How frequently the logs should be transferred in seconds. Default `3600`.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed, overriding any `format_version` default. Can be either `none` or `waf_debug`.

PublicKey.description: A PGP public key that Fastly will use to encrypt your log files before writing them to disk.

ResponseCondition.description: The name of the `condition` to apply. If empty, always execute.

SasToken.description: The Azure shared access signature providing write access to the blob service objects. Be sure to update your token before it expires or the logging functionality will not work.

Action.description:
One of `cache`, `pass`, or `restart`, as defined
on Fastly's documentation under ["Caching action descriptions"](https://docs.fastly.com/guides/performance-tuning/controlling-caching#caching-action-descriptions).

CacheCondition.description: Name of already defined `condition` used to test whether this settings object should be used. This `condition` must be of type `CACHE`.

Name.description: Unique name for this Cache Setting.

StaleTtl.description: Max "Time To Live" for stale (unreachable) objects.

Name.description: Unique name to refer to this Request Setting.
A unique name to identify this dictionary.

WriteOnly.description:
If `true`, the dictionary is a private dictionary, and items are not readable in the UI or
via API. Default is `false`. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the
dictionary, discard the current items in the dictionary. Using a write-only/private dictionary should only be done if
the items are managed outside of Terraform.

Backends.description: Names of defined backends to map the director to. Example: `[ "origin1", "origin2" ]`.

Capacity.description: Load balancing weight for the backends. Default `100`.

Comment.description: An optional comment about the Director.

Name.description: Unique name for this Director.

Quorum.description: Percentage of capacity that needs to be up for the director itself to be considered up. Default `75`.

Retries.description: How many backends to search if it fails. Default `5`.

Shield.description: Selected POP to serve as a "shield" for origin servers.

Type.description: Type of load balance group to use. Integer, 1 to 4. Values: `1` (random), `3` (hash), `4` (client).  Default `1`.

Comment.description: An optional comment about the Domain.

Name.description: The domain to which this Service will respond.
A name that is unique across "regular" and "dynamic" VCL Snippet configuration blocks.

Priority.description: Priority determines the ordering for multiple snippets. Lower numbers execute first.  Defaults to `100`.

Type.description: The location in generated VCL where the snippet should be placed (can be one of `init`, `recv`, `hit`, `miss`, `pass`, `fetch`, `error`, `deliver`, `log` or `none`).

BucketName.description: The name of the bucket in which to store the logs.

Email.description: The email address associated with the target GCS bucket on your account. You may optionally provide this secret via an environment variable, `FASTLY_GCS_EMAIL`.

Format.description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (`%h %l %u %t %r %>s`).

GzipLevel.description:
Level of GZIP compression, from `0-9`. `0` is no
compression. `1` is fastest and least compressed, `9` is slowest and most
compressed. Default `0`.

MessageType.description: How the message should be formatted; one of: `classic`, `loggly`, `logplex` or `blank`. Default `classic`. [Fastly Documentation](https://docs.fastly.com/api/logging#logging_gcs).

Name.description: A unique name to identify this GCS endpoint.

Path.description:
Path to store the files. Must end with a trailing slash.
If this field is left empty, the files will be saved in the bucket's root path.

Period.description:
How frequently the logs should be transferred, in
seconds. Default `3600`.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: `none` or `waf_debug`.

ResponseCondition.description: Name of already defined `condition` to apply. This `condition` must be of type `RESPONSE`. For detailed information about Conditionals, see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals][fastly-conditionals].

SecretKey.description: The secret key associated with the target gcs bucket on your account. You may optionally provide this secret via an environment variable, `FASTLY_GCS_SECRET_KEY`. A typical format for the key is PEM format, containing actual newline characters where required.

CacheCondition.description: Name of already defined `condition` to apply. This `condition` must be of type `CACHE`.

ContentTypes.description:
The content-type for each type of content you wish to
have dynamically gzip'ed. Example: `["text/html", "text/css"]`.

Extensions.description:
File extensions for each file type to dynamically
gzip. Example: `["css", "js"]`.

Name.description: Unique name for this header attribute.

CheckInterval.description: How often to run the Healthcheck in milliseconds. Default `5000`.

ExpectedResponse.description: The status code expected from the host. Default `200`.

Host.description: The Host header to send for this Healthcheck.

HttpVersion.description: Whether to use version 1.0 or 1.1 HTTP. Default `1.1`.

Initial.description: When loading a config, the initial number of probes to be seen as OK. Default `2`.

Method.description: Which HTTP method to use. Default `HEAD`.

Name.description: A unique name to identify this Healthcheck.

Threshold.description: How many Healthchecks must succeed to be considered healthy. Default `3`.

Window.description: The number of most recent Healthcheck queries to keep for this Healthcheck. Default `5`.

Format.description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (`%h %l %u %t %r %>s`).

FormatVersion.description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 (the default, version 1 log format) or 2 (the version 2 log format).

Name.description: A unique name to identify this GCS endpoint.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: `none` or `waf_debug`.

Port.description: The port number configured in Logentries to send logs to. Defaults to `20000`.

ResponseCondition.description: Name of already defined `condition` to apply. This `condition` must be of type `RESPONSE`. For detailed information about Conditionals, see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals][fastly-conditionals].

Token.description: Logentries Token to be used for authentication (https://logentries.com/doc/input-token/).

UseTls.description: Whether to use TLS for secure logging. Defaults to `true`.

Address.description: The address of the Papertrail endpoint.

Format.description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (`%h %l %u %t %r %>s`).

Name.description: A unique name to identify this Papertrail endpoint.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: `none` or `waf_debug`.

Port.description: The port associated with the address where the Papertrail endpoint can be accessed.

ResponseCondition.description:
Name of already defined `condition` to apply. This `condition` must be of type `RESPONSE`. For detailed information about Conditionals,
see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals][fastly-conditionals].

CacheCondition.description:
Name of already defined `condition` to check after we have retrieved an object. If the condition passes then deliver this Request Object instead. This `condition` must be of type `CACHE`. For detailed information about Conditionals,
see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals][fastly-conditionals].

Content.description: The content to deliver for the response object.

ContentType.description: The MIME type of the content.

Name.description: A unique name to identify this Response Object.

RequestCondition.description: Name of already defined `condition` to be checked during the request phase. If the condition passes then this object will be delivered. This `condition` must be of type `REQUEST`.

BucketName.description: The name of the bucket in which to store the logs.

Domain.description:
If you created the S3 bucket outside of `us-east-1`,
then specify the corresponding bucket endpoint. Example: `s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com`.

Format.description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (`%h %l %u %t %r %>s`).

FormatVersion.description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 (the default, version 1 log format) or 2 (the version 2 log format).

GzipLevel.description:
Level of GZIP compression, from `0-9`. `0` is no
compression. `1` is fastest and least compressed, `9` is slowest and most
compressed. Default `0`.

MessageType.description: How the message should be formatted; one of: `classic`, `loggly`, `logplex` or `blank`.  Default `classic`.

Name.description: A unique name to identify this S3 Logging Bucket.

Path.description:
Path to store the files. Must end with a trailing slash.
If this field is left empty, the files will be saved in the bucket's root path.

Period.description:
How frequently the logs should be transferred, in
seconds. Default `3600`.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: `none` or `waf_debug`.

Redundancy.description: The S3 redundancy level. Should be formatted; one of: `standard`, `reduced_redundancy` or null. Default `null`.

ResponseCondition.description:
Name of already defined `condition` to apply. This `condition` must be of type `RESPONSE`. For detailed information about Conditionals,
see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals][fastly-conditionals].

S3AccessKey.description:
AWS Access Key of an account with the required
permissions to post logs. It is **strongly** recommended you create a separate
IAM user with permissions to only operate on this Bucket. This key will be
not be encrypted. You can provide this key via an environment variable, `FASTLY_S3_ACCESS_KEY`.

S3SecretKey.description:
AWS Secret Key of an account with the required
permissions to post logs. It is **strongly** recommended you create a separate
IAM user with permissions to only operate on this Bucket. This secret will be
not be encrypted. You can provide this secret via an environment variable, `FASTLY_S3_SECRET_KEY`.

Name.description: A name that is unique across "regular" and "dynamic" VCL Snippet configuration blocks.

Priority.description: Priority determines the ordering for multiple snippets. Lower numbers execute first.  Defaults to `100`.

Type.description: The location in generated VCL where the snippet should be placed (can be one of `init`, `recv`, `hit`, `miss`, `pass`, `fetch`, `error`, `deliver`, `log` or `none`).

Format.description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Default `%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b`.

FormatVersion.description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either `1` or `2`. The logging call gets placed by default in `vcl_log` if `format_version` is set to `2` and in `vcl_deliver` if `format_version` is set to `1`. Default `2`.

Name.description: A unique name to identify the Splunk endpoint.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed, overriding any `format_version` default. Can be either `none` or `waf_debug`.

ResponseCondition.description: The name of the `condition` to apply. If empty, always execute.

Token.description: The Splunk token to be used for authentication.

Url.description: The Splunk URL to stream logs to.

Format.description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (`%h %l %u %t %r %>s`).

FormatVersion.description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 (the default, version 1 log format) or 2 (the version 2 log format).

MessageType.description: How the message should be formatted; one of: `classic`, `loggly`, `logplex` or `blank`. Default `classic`. See [Fastly's Documentation on Sumologic][fastly-sumologic].

Name.description: A unique name to identify this Sumologic endpoint.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: `none` or `waf_debug`.

ResponseCondition.description: Name of already defined `condition` to apply. This `condition` must be of type `RESPONSE`. For detailed information about Conditionals, see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals][fastly-conditionals].

Url.description: The URL to Sumologic collector endpoint.

Address.description: A hostname or IPv4 address of the Syslog endpoint.

Format.description: Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting. Defaults to Apache Common Log format (%h %l %u %t %r %>s).

FormatVersion.description: The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 (the default, version 1 log format) or 2 (the version 2 log format).

MessageType.description: How the message should be formatted; one of: `classic`, `loggly`, `logplex` or `blank`.  Default `classic`.

Name.description: A unique name to identify this Syslog endpoint.

Placement.description: Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed; one of: `none` or `waf_debug`.

Port.description: The port associated with the address where the Syslog endpoint can be accessed. Default `514`.

ResponseCondition.description:
Name of already defined `condition` to apply. This `condition` must be of type `RESPONSE`. For detailed information about Conditionals,
see [Fastly's Documentation on Conditionals][fastly-conditionals].

TlsCaCert.description: A secure certificate to authenticate the server with. Must be in PEM format. You can provide this certificate via an environment variable, `FASTLY_SYSLOG_CA_CERT`.

TlsClientCert.description: The client certificate used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format. You can provide this certificate via an environment variable, `FASTLY_SYSLOG_CLIENT_CERT`.

TlsClientKey.description: The client private key used to make authenticated requests. Must be in PEM format. You can provide this key via an environment variable, `FASTLY_SYSLOG_CLIENT_KEY`.

TlsHostname.description: Used during the TLS handshake to validate the certificate.

Token.description: Whether to prepend each message with a specific token.

UseTls.description: Whether to use TLS for secure logging. Default `false`.

Content.description: The custom VCL code to upload.

Main.description:
If `true`, use this block as the main configuration. If
`false`, use this block as an includable library. Only a single VCL block can be
marked as the main block. Default is `false`.

Name.description: A unique name for this configuration block.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

Activate.description: Conditionally prevents the Service from being activated. The apply step will continue to create a new draft version but will not activate it if this is set to false. Default true.

Comment.description: Description field for the service. Default `Managed by Terraform`.

ForceDestroy.description:
Services that are active cannot be destroyed. In
order to destroy the Service, set `force_destroy` to `true`. Default `false`.

Name.description: The unique name for the Service to create.
